column1: poppynhi 160829971167 "2017-05-19 06:02:36 GMT" https://poppynhi.tumblr.com/post/160829971167/to-high-school-students-wanting-to-sit-for-pledge "teal-deer:  doncoyote:  teal-deer:  righthandofscaevola:  xtumble-weedx:  bettaesthetic:  consuljuniper:  Back when I was in high school
column2: I sat for the pledge to protest the Iraq War. This was in 2002-2003 when people were hyper-patriotic and nationalistic
column3: slightly more than you see today (though still maddening today). Anyway
column4: I got sent to the principleâ€™s office and so on and so forth
column5: and teachers and administrators wanted to punish me. However
column7: I was well educated. If you decide to sit
column8: please keep in mind Tinker vs. Des Moines. That is a Supreme Court lawÂ  that states students do not relinquish their Constitutional rights when they enter school. This means you have the freedom to protest
column9: as long as itâ€™s peaceful and not disruptive to school
column10: such as wearing an armband or sitting for the pledge. They cannot force you to stand
column11: and they cannot punish you. That would be unconstitutional. Do not be deterred in any peaceful protest. You are allowed to have your voice
column12: anyone that that says otherwise is full of shit and doesnâ€™t know the law.  I sat for the pledge all of 8th grade. But the first time
column13: the teacher next door came over and yelled at me for â€œmaking a sceneâ€. So the next day I brought in my fucken student handbook that SAYS IN PRINT students may sit or stand while reciting the pledge OR saying nothing at all. That asshole. Then he had the audacity to call me out in front of the class â€œWhy wonâ€™t you say the pledge huh? Religious reasons? Did your parents tell you not to?â€  I literally said
column14: because I donâ€™t have to. Because I LITERALLY DO NOT HAVE TO. Itâ€™s my right and I will take it.  Look sit during the pledge or whatever
column15: just know itâ€™s really pretty disrespectful.My brother is out putting his life on the line for you ungrateful people. The least you could do is stand up. If not for your government
column16: then for the men and women that are dying for you.  No. Stop this nonsense of calling people ungrateful for sitting for a pledge. The Pledge of Allegiance isnâ€™t about soldiers fighting â€œfor us.â€ The Pledge is a creepy
column17: indoctrinating ritual that hasnâ€™t even been around the entirety of this country.  Iâ€™m not even getting into all the issues with the miliary industrial complex. But stop being conned into thinking that the Pledge is somehow about your brother.  You can be critical of this government and the military without being critical or individual soldiers. This idea that we need to do something because it is â€œdisrespectfulâ€ to someone that has nothing to do with it is ridiculous.  You think all these people donâ€™t have family in the military? Or that some of these people might be in the military? I know people in the military that sat for the Pledge. Because they knew the Pledge wasnâ€™t about them.  Sitting for the Pledge can also be an act of patriotism as well. Itâ€™s an act of peaceful protest. listen my military friends sit My military friends THANKED ME for SITTING because theyâ€™re pretty fucking done with a country that sends them off to murder random brown people Because Patriotism or whatever stop using military folk as a strawman theyâ€™re people with lives too anyway
column19: I was a 3.5 average student (not quite straight-A because ADHD
column20: but my teachers knew this and accepted this) and I happened to have teachers in 2nd period (when the pledge was) who let me sit my cool ass with my cowboy hat (also Very Not Allowed in American Schools) (Hats in general
column21: not specifically cowboy hats) (I am in whiteass suburbia on the East Coast btw where cowboy hats are unusual) in the front fucking row reading books while the Pledge happened becauseÂ  1. They knew me and knew that beyond this I was an Upstanding Citizen and 2. Most of them
column22: being in Liberal-Ass Montgomery County Maryland
column23: aka one of the richest whiteass best public school systems in the country
column24: all secretly agreed with me PS: Pledge is a fairly recent jingoistic bullshit invention and only made officially part of public school in theÂ â€˜50s in reaction to the Red Scare
column26: it originates out of fear of the Russians. Yâ€™know
column27: the folks who our Esteemed Leader is sucking off constantly.Â   I did NOT serve for 8.5 years just some punk ass can use me or my brethren in arms to SHAME fellow citizens for following both their conscience and exercising their Constitutional FUCKING RIGHTS! Folks like that tumble-weed fucker can get right the fuck off with their bullshit jingoism.   im just gonna point to this post by doncoyote here nowÂ  big hugs dude " False text

column1: poppynhi 160420121167 "2017-05-07 22:16:02 GMT" https://poppynhi.tumblr.com/post/160420121167/to-the-shippers-of-the-samurai-jack-fandom "It is sad to see the shippers of the Samurai Jack fandom telling other fans who just wanted to see Jackâ€™s journey come to fruition
column2: to just suck it up and accept that Jack and Ashi are the canon couple. I have been in fandoms where shipping wars happened. I have seen people sending hate to each other and others getting hurt. In order to write a good romance with a good story
column3: in my opinion
column4: the intended characters need to have a good amount of interactions over a suggested long period of time. The romance should not take over the plot. It should go hand in hand with the plot. It cannot happen all of a sudden in one episode. I accept all sorts of relationships. You just cannot have two characters be together just for the aesthetics. You cannot assume those do not like the ship
column5: to actually want a same-sex ship. Thatâ€™s like assuming apple to actually be an orange. Why can we not act civil towards another? We as the fans
column6: can accept what the creator has in mind and have different opinions on many topics and be respectful. We should not label each other as haters
column7: and should respect each other as fellow fans. Please comment below on your thoughts on the recent episode. Just remember to be respectful not bash on others." True text

column1: poppynhi 126730168087 "2015-08-15 06:30:02 GMT" https://poppynhi.tumblr.com/post/126730168087/sesame-street-is-moving-to-hbo-and-the-symbolism "powwhamteaching: â€œIn short
column2: Sesame Street was founded to help low-income kids keep up with their more affluent peers. That is literally why it exists. It succeeded beyond anyoneâ€™s expectations. And now it is becoming the property of a premium cable network
column3: so that a program launched to help poor kids keep up with rich kids is now being paywalled so that rich kids can watch it before poor kids can. â€œThat in itself is not a tragedy or an injustice. Tragedy is the devastating funding cuts that Head Start has suffered in recent years
column4: affecting tens of thousands of young children. Injustice is the nationwide lack of subsidized high-quality child care and universal pre-K. In this context
column5: relocating Sesame Street to the gated community of HBOâ€”even if that communityâ€™s gates swing wide at nine-month intervalsâ€”is only to be expected. There could be no more cruelly perfect metaphor for the ultra-efficient sorting processes of socioeconomic privilege.â€ " False link
